sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词均含"完美的，极好的"之意。
means: perfect ： 用于褒义指某人或某物等达到理想中的完美无缺；用于贬义，则相反，指十足的坏。
ideal ： 语气较强，指完美到使人称心如意的地步。

sentence.Network_en: The reality of mothering is frequently very different from the romantic ideal.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a term in Platonic philosophy, in the sense 'existing as an archetype'): from late Latin idealis, from Latin idea (see idea)

entry.def: An ideal is a principle, idea, or standard that seems very good and worth trying to achieve.

example.ex: ...the bohemian ideals of truth, beauty, freedom and love.
example.tran: 崇信真、美、自由与爱的波西米亚式理想

example.ex: I tried to live up to my ideal of myself.
example.tran: 我努力活出理想的自我。

entry.def: Your ideal of something is the person or thing that seems to you to be the best possible example of it.

example.tran: 日本人理想中的美人形象

example.ex: Throughout his career she remained his feminine ideal.
example.tran: 在他整个职业生涯中，她一直是他心中完美女性的代表。

entry.def: The ideal person or thing for a particular task or purpose is the best possible person or thing for it.

example.ex: She decided that I was the ideal person to take over the job...
example.tran: 她认定我是接手这份工作的最佳人选。

example.ex: I really love the area and see it as an ideal place to start my managerial career...
example.tran: 我真的很喜欢那个地区，把它视为开创我管理事业的理想之地。

entry.def: An ideal society or world is the best possible one that you can imagine.

example.ex: We do not live in an ideal world...
example.tran: 我们并非生活在完美的世界里。

example.ex: In an ideal world, there would be no such thing as rubbish...
example.tran: 在一个理想世界中，不会有垃圾之类的东西。

means.word_mean: 1. the idea of something that is perfect; something that one hopes to attain
2. model of excellence or perfection of a kind; one having no equal
1. conforming to an ultimate standard of perfection or excellence; embodying an ideal
2. constituting or existing only in the form of an idea or mental image or conception;

sentences.sentence: "a poem or essay may be typical of its period in idea or ideal content"

means.word_mean: 3. of or relating to the philosophical doctrine of the reality of ideas

stems_affixes.value_cn: 理想的;空想的;理想主义的;唯心的
stems_affixes.word_buile: idea思想,观点+al……的→ideal有想法的→有理想
idea思想,观点+al……的→ideal有想法的→有理想
ideal[adj.理想的;空想的;理想主义的;唯心的 n.理想]+ism主义→n.唯心主义;理想主义
ideal[adj.理想的;空想的;理想主义的;唯心的 n.理想]+ize……化→理想化
idea思想,观点+ate表动词→想象→设想

The ideal companion machine would not only look, feel, and sound friendly but would also be programmed to behave in an agreeable manner.

Its clean air, attractive parks, and the absence of any industry, make this an ideal spot for people looking for a quiet life.

sentences.en: She's looking for a husband[job] but hasn't found her ideal yet.
sentences.cn: 她在寻找一个丈夫[一份工作], 但迄今为止还没有找到理想的。

jushi.english: We should throw the ideal plan for reforming the world.
jushi.chinese: 我们应该抛掉改造世界的空想计划。

jushi.english: My ideal profession is to be a doctor.
jushi.chinese: 我理想的职业是当医生。

jushi.english: The place is ideal for a holiday.
